chief.note: Commissioned to Colombia (i.e. “Gran Colombia,” which separated into the states of Ecuador, New Granada, and Venezuela).

No report has been found concerning Watts’s presentation of credentials as Chargé d’Affaires en titre; he had been serving at Bogota as Chargé d’Affaires ad interim since June 1826. Commissioned to Colombia (i.e. “Gran Colombia,” which separated into the states of Ecuador, New Granada, and Venezuela).

Commissioned to New Granada.

ended.note: Left post on or soon after

ended.note: Notified the Government of Colombia that he would have no further relations with it

chief.note: Burton did not present credentials addressed in 1861 to the President of the Granadian Confederacy, but eventually did present credentials addressed in 1863 to the President of the United States of Colombia.
Commissioned during a recess of the Senate; recommissioned on December 11, 1873, after confirmation.

ended.note: Promoted to Envoy Extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary
